plurals.name: error_cannot_convert_more_than_x_programs
plurals.item: Non posso convertire più di 1 programma alla volta!
Non posso convertire più di %d programmi alla volta!

In order to be allowed to use Pocket Code and other executables offered by the Catrobat project, you must agree to our Terms of use and services and strictly follow them when you use Pocket Code and our other executables. Please see the link below for their precise formulation.\n
Pocket Code terms of use and services
You attempt to use Pocket Code together with Parrot\'s AR.Drone. We strongly remind you to abide to Parrot\'s terms of use and services for the drone and to Catrobat\'s terms of use for Pocket Code.

Pocket Code è un ambiente di programmazione e un interprete per dispositivi Android per il linguaggio di programmazione visuale Catrobat.

 Il codice sorgente di Pocket Code è rilasciato principalmente con licenza GNU AGPL v3. Per i dettagli precisi della licenza, vedere il link seguente.
Licenza del codice sorgente di Pocket Code

Caution! Different resolutions detected. %1$s has resolution %2$dx%3$d and %4$s has resolution %5$dx%6$d. Using resolution of %1$s.
Variable %1$s is used in both programs. If programs use the same variable name they cannot be merged. Please rename the variable in one of the programs and try again.
List %1$s is used in both programs. If programs use the same name for their lists they cannot be merged. Please rename the list in one of the programs and try again.
"The flash can be used with the back camera only. Please add a \"Use camera\" brick and change to your device\'s back camera. "
If you enjoy Pocket Code, please rate us on Google Play!
Deleting a variable that is still in use is dangerous! Are you sure?
Your program gets uploaded to our community page where others can use and download it. You can also download your program as standalone app.
All bricks are sorted in categories. Choose the category you are looking for.
To add a brick to your script tap on the brick you want to use.
Short tap on a brick opens the menu to move, copy, delete or add a brick to the backpack. The help option will show you additional information. Drag and drop the brick with a long press.
The script defines the behaviour of your object. To add bricks to the script tap on the \"+\" symbol.
Here you can find the different appearances of your object. To add a new look tap on the \"+\" symbol.
Here you can add new sounds to your object. Keep in mind to use a brick from the sound category.
Your program consists of different objects that can interact with each other. To add a new object tap on the \"+\" symbol.
To merge two programs long press on one program to open the menu and tap on \'Merge with\'.
Hit the back-button to pause your program. To show axes and the screen size of your phone tap \"Axes on\".
A program can consist of different independent scenes. To add a new scene tap on the \"+\" symbol.
Please help to improve Pocket Code by sending us anonymous crash reports!
